conversation.content: 他们签了。那个特赦令，我是说。[relieved] 这次是真的了。[pause] 七年了...七年来我一直东躲西藏的，用假名字住小旅馆，现在我终于——我终于能光明正大地走在街上了。[quietly] 用我自己的名字。[short pause] 但是我昨天去了Sarah家，那里，呃...现在住着另一家人。[confused] 门前停着小孩的自行车，窗帘也换了。[sadly] 我们以前每周四都去的那个咖啡店？[pause] 现在变成果汁吧了。[bitter] 操，果汁吧。[sigh] 还有Mark，他——嗯，他结婚了，听说。[very quietly] 跟一个我根本不认识的人。[pause] 我一直在想...我错过了...我错过了太多东西。[regretful] 妈妈的葬礼，Sarah的婚礼，我侄子学走路。[voice breaking] 七年的生日、圣诞节，还有那些...普普通通的周二下午。[anxiously] 大家都往前走了，你知道吧？[pause] 都建立起了新的生活，里面已经没有我的位置了。[hesitantly] 我也理解，真的，但是...怎么说呢...就像在自己的，呃，在自己的葬礼上当鬼魂一样。[very sad] 他们早就把我当死人哀悼过了。[long pause] 那我现在该怎么办？[confused] 就这样出现说"嘿，还记得我吗？"[trailing off] 好像什么都没发生过...

original_conversation.content: They signed it. The pardon, I mean. [relieved] It's actually real this time. [pause] After seven years of... of looking over my shoulder, sleeping in motels under fake names, I can just—I can walk down a street again. [quietly] Use my own name. [short pause] But I went by Sarah's place yesterday and there's, um... there's another family living there now. [confused] Kids' bikes in the driveway, different curtains. [sadly] The coffee shop where we used to meet every Thursday? [pause] It's a juice bar now. [bitter] A fucking juice bar. [sigh] And Mark, he—well, he got married apparently. [very quietly] To someone I've never even heard of. [pause] I keep thinking about how I missed... I missed everything. [regretful] Mom's funeral, Sarah's wedding, my nephew learning to walk. [voice breaking] Seven years of birthdays and Christmases and just... regular Tuesday afternoons. [anxiously] Everyone's moved on, you know? [pause] Built these whole lives that don't have a space for me anymore. [hesitantly] And I get it, I do, but... hmm... it's like being a ghost at your own, uh, at your own wake or something. [very sad] They mourned me already. [long pause] So what am I supposed to do now? [confused] Just show up and say "Hey, remember me?" [trailing off] Like nothing happened...

subject: Your fugitive status ending with a pardon, but returning to a world that moved on without you
